info.title: Guardian Content API
info.description: The Content API is a public service for accessing all the content the Guardian creates and the collections we have of that content (tags and sections). There are over one and a half million items available published as far back as 1999. This overview will give you some idea of what data is available, how to find what you need, and what you will see when you make a request to us.

parameters.name: api-key
parameters.description: The API key used for the query

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: The javascript callback name to wrap the JSON response. Read HTTP Status Codes and APIs: how the Guardians Content API does it for more details

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format to return the results in

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Returns results only for that page index

parameters.name: page-size
parameters.description: Modify the number of items displayed per page

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Request tags containing this free text

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Return only tags with those references

parameters.name: reference-type
parameters.description: Return only tags with references of those types

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Return only tags in those sections

parameters.name: show-references
parameters.description: Show associated reference data such as ISBNs

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Return only tags of those types
